step: Mix the Epsom salts, sea salt and baking soda together well.
Add a few drops of food color for desired color.
Add 1 tablespoon of skin safe fragrance oil.
Add 1/2 cup of citric acid.
Use a funnel to pour the fizzy salts mixture in a jar or container.
Seal the jar or container.
Measure 1 cup of lemon juice, and 2 tablespoons of salt together in a small bowl.
Place the lemon juice and salt in a pan and boil.
Scrape off the crust with a spoon.
Place the crust in a clean bowl.
Continue to boil.
Keep the process going.
Drain all of the juice from the crust.
Put the crust, now dry, in a small container.
Eat little by little, or save to put on top of flavorless crackers.

task: How to Make a Water Colour Salt Painting
step: Set up your painting area.
Wet your paper.
Paint with watercolors.
Sprinkle some salt over the still-wet painting.
Let the painting dry.
When the painting is dry, tip the paper up gently and shake the excess salt off.
Finished!.

task: How to Make a Salt Dough Name Banner
step: Gather the ingredients for salt dough.
Make the dough.
Knead the dough.
Divide the dough into pieces based on the letters in your name.
Shape the dough into the letters of your name.
Poke holes in the top of each letter.
Decorate!.
Bake the beads at 350 degrees for 30 minutes to an hour.
Paint the letters and add any more decorations.
String together all the letters.
Select a flavored liquid for your salt.
Bring the liquid to a boil.
Heat the liquid until it forms a reduction.
Add the salt and dry the mixture.
Choose a chalk color that you wish to use.
Cover the workspace with a large sheet of paper.
Pour the salt onto the paper.
Place the piece of chalk on its side, on the salt.
Using the paper as a funnel, pour the chalk-colored salt into a resealable bag or a storage container.
Done.

task: How to Prepare a Sea Salt Soak
step: Pour 453 g (1.9 cups) of fine grain sea salt into a bowl.
Consider adding 15 to 30 drops of scented or essential oil to the sea salt.
Mix the salts and oils thoroughly then store the mix in a glass container.
Add 120 g (1/2 cup) of the salt soak to a warm bath and let it dissolve.
Take a bath with the sea salt soak when you need to relax and unwind.

task: How to Make Sandalwood Bath Salts
step: Assemble ingredients.
Mix together dry ingredients in a ceramic bowl.
Add the essential oils.
Stir as you add the drops.
Place mixture into a small jar and screw on the lid.
Keep in a dry spot out of direct sunlight for 2 - 3 days to allow the oils to blend.
Use bath salts.
Vary the grain size to get different effects.
Add the salt immediately to the wet paint for a more wide-spread effect.
Wait 1-2 minutes for the paint to dry for more concentrated speckles.
Try adding salt to water to get bursts of color.
